intro: Troximon heterophyllum var. glabratum, commonly known as the smoothleaf troximon, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its smooth, glabrous leaves and small, clustered white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as along stream banks or in forest understories. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a distinct, aromatic scent when crushed. The fruit is a dry, two-lobed schizocarp that splits into two one-seeded units upon maturity.
